title: Marine Le Pen's political future is at stake as her appeal trial opens
subhed: The far-right leader, convicted of embezzling public funds, is approaching a pivotal moment: The judges' decision will determine whether she can participate in the 2027 presidential election.

title: Iranian regime rallies supporters in bid to quell unrest
With US eyeing Greenland, NATO faces one of its most crucial tests
byline: By Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau) and Anne-Françoise Hivert (Malmö (Sweden), regional correspondent)

title: Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminials' grip on island
subhed: Alain Orsoni, a former leader of the Movement for Self-Determination on the French island of Corsica, had spent time in exile in Nicaragua. Local police said his shooting death at his mother's funeral resembled those targeting associates of his son, a figure of the island's criminal underworld.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhed: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Moroccan King Mohammed VI's quiet absence from AFCON
subhed: The Moroccan monarch has not made a single public appearance since the start of the Africa Cup of Nations, the biggest sporting event the kingdom has ever hosted. According to a statement from his personal physician, his absence is due to back pain.

title: Being gay in Uganda, where the death penalty looms
subhed: Since Uganda's Parliament introduced the death penalty for 'aggravated homosexuality' in 2023, young homosexual people have been forced underground, with only brief moments of freedom, such as the Nyege Nyege electronic music festival.

Venezuela's Delcy Rodriguez faces an obstacle-strewn path
subhed: The interim president, appointed after the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, must preserve the unity of Chavism while ensuring that she does not incur the wrath of Donald Trump.

title: Exclusive images: On the set of 'Marty Supreme,' Timothée Chalamet dominates the game
subhed: In 'Marty Supreme,' directed by Josh Safdie, Timothée Chalamet plays Marty Mauser, a character inspired by the 1950s table tennis star Marty Reisman. With a Golden Globe win, the role cements the 30-year-old as one of the greatest actors of his generation. Photographer Tim El Kaïm had exclusive access to the set of this highly anticipated film, which is set for release in France in February.

title: Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown
subhed: Videos, uploaded to social media despite the internet shutdown in Iran, show a vast number of corpses piled up in the forensic center's warehouse and lined up in the yard. Witnesses corroborated the footage to Le Monde.
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky
